Peter Ghin, from Melbourne University Future of Work Lab says this regional boom is also reshaping our workforce demographics.

@BreakfastNews We went the opposite way...regional coastal NSW  housing was out of reach so we moved Melbourne  where we can afford to buy and rent at a lower price in a better dwelling.

@LimespringsB @DanielG71690653 I think you answered your own question - WA prices never been "as high as Sydney and Melbourne"

That said, Perth is still nudging $1M median house price. That's higher than Brisbane and not far off Melbourne. Not sure that proves anything one way or another re govt equity loans

@Dontaskme112 @Erasec @noplaceforsheep Median house price for a 80's 3bed brick veneer is $900,000 in Coffs Harbour, thanks to cashed-up waves of covid refugees from first Melbourne, then Sydney, now Hunter/Central Coast. 4 years ago the same house was under $400,000.
Imagine living in the desert but pay rent 22% more than Australia's Melbourne. American housing prices are just outrageous. https://t.co/z3elkTsYWw

@IForgot49835002 @milamiarose @BeachGirlJan Affordability is about more than the house price, wages & interest rates. It’s also about access to finance which was more difficult back then. Eg. My parents on two decent wages could only afford to live in outer suburbs of Melbourne & lived more frugally than we do now.

@arozenbachs Yeah and in mid 1980's  a house median price that was 2 or 3 times average gross yearly income. What's the ratio in Sydney or Melbourne these days? If interests rates move a fraction of what the got to in 1987 to 1990 it will a bloodbath in parts of the major cities.
@debritz @samanthamaiden @joshgnosis In Sydney and Melbourne the median price of a house is approximately 20 times the median income of the populous.

@StevePriceMedia 1970 Melbourne median house price: $12, 800
1970 Australian median salary: $6000

2022 Melbourne median house price: $800,000
2022 Australian median salary: $67, 000

1970s buying a house? 2x your salary.
2022 buying a house? 12x your salary.

Enough said.

@theprojecttv 1970 Melbourne median house price: $12, 800
1970 Australian median salary: $6000

2022 Melbourne median house price: $800,000
2022 Australian median salary: $67, 000

1970s buying a house? Will be 2x your salary.
2022 buying a house? That's 12x your salary.

Enough said.
